result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Harold Crawford

defendant.name: Crawford, Harold
defendant.address: 7829 West Beckett Avenue, Lower, Milwaukee, WI 53218

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Harold Crawford appeared by phone.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Pre-trial conference held. Court instructed the defendant to call the Public Defender's Office after today's court proceedings to determine eligibility. Court adjourns the matter for defendant to appear in person in Branch 29.
Status conference scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Cash bail previously posted to be used towards cash bail set. Remaining cash bail to be returned to remitter. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with AML, SJB.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Harold Crawford in court. Student Intern Madeline Whitty under the supervision of Prosecuting attorney Thomas L. Potter in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible.  
The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 29.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 9/23/22 @ 1p
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on September 23, 2022 at 1:00 PM.
